website_summaries.verdict: Very bright wide beam flashlight. Designed to be easy to hold and use, with its large flashlight body.
pros: Several hours of use between charges
Throws LED light over a long distance
Easy to aim the light beam with a design that resembles a household drill
cons: Questionable build quality over the long haul

website_summaries.verdict: This spotlight's dependable performance and durability makes it worth the higher price tag. The best on the market.
pros: A must-have for anyone seeking prolonged battery life and ultra-powerful LED lights

customer_reviews.title: Comparing the Stanley and NoCry spolights
customer_reviews.text: You can see from the video, the Stanley has a more focused beam - concentrating all the light into one spot, which actually makes it seem a bit brighter than the NoCry (not nearly 2.2x as bright as claimed though), but considering the differences in runtime and the waterproof, tough, well balanced, lightweight design of the NoCry model for me the NoCry offers better value. Runtime: Max setting for Stanley 2 hours, for NoCry 6 hours. 2nd setting for Stanley 7 hours, for NoCry 12 hours. 3rd setting for NoCry 20 hours, which is perfect for in-tent use for example. Charging time 4 hours for NoCry and 6 hours for Stanlely.
customer_reviews.author: Pretty Bird

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge 3-8 months later, happened with 2 flashlights.
customer_reviews.text: Initially works well, then wont charge. I had one for 8 months... then would not charge...And would turn on and then off within 2 seconds. So I ordered a new charger, but it did still would not charge and would turn off on it's own. I liked the design and output of the light so I ordered the same one 1 year later thinking the first one not lasting was a fluke. It initially worked fine, but now 3 months later the red light flashes when charging, Sometimes charges fine, sometimes not. Also the car charger does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 5

customer_reviews.title: The Owl Spotter
customer_reviews.text: A great spotlight that sends a beam out as far as the eye can see. I point it at the side of our house from 100 yards away and it lights up the entire side of the house. I use the Stanley mostly as a spotlight when I take out the 2 small Maltipoos at night. Definitely bright enough to spot the Owls at 100 yards away in the tree. Here's a picture of an owl spotted at 30 yards away.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: This battery is already toast after only a couple of uses!!! Can't replace anything to boot. I like the trigger handle vs the one I bought prior where you push a button to lock it in, (which by the way still works). Other than the trigger holding itself so light stay lit, I totally wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: ~M~

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light for my boat. I followed the instruction on charging the light for first time. However, after using It a couple month's later it did not work correctly. Thinking it was the battery I charged it again. Come to find out it wouldn't hold a charge. It would only go on for a few seconds then keep shuting off. Wasted my money, very disappointed in this product. Its not like Stanley products to fail right of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Batteries dont last long on them... This is my 2nd and its broken
customer_reviews.text: I got this spot light to use to take out my dog at night so I can see. We live in a very wooded area and have many critters that live around here. I had gotten this light awhile back and with in months it completely stopped working on me. I got to send it back for a replacement. I've now had this spotlight now for about a year and now the battery isnt holding a charge. I'm very disappointed with this product. Its an excellent spot light if your planning on buying them annually however I wouldnt recommend it to anyone. Save your money and buy a better one. THESE BATTERIES DONT LAST LONG, Trust me...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good for huntin' critters
customer_reviews.text: My ageing mother routinely battles critters who are trying to eat her chickens. After her former light went to be with the Good Lord, I bought this to get her back in action. So far being armed with this light and a .22lr, she has suffered the loss of no chickens, however she is still mourning the loss of one wheelburrow tire and a water bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The light beam turns off after 10-20 seconds. I've recharged it several times but the results are always the same. I purchased it back in 2017 but it has only sits at my bedside and is very seldom used (a dozen times?) since it is very bright and fairly large. It soes not seem like Amazon or the manufacturer are open to returns this far down the road, but it is clearly defective since I have much cheaper flashlights still working after many more years (and usage) of service. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pendra LaFee

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on this light when you need it. Second bad one!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are a total. POS!! SECOND ONE IN 2 YEARS.. Both had same problem, (Will not shut off, then will not turn back on) seems to be common problem too. First light probably had 1hr on it, second had 15min. Don't even think about using this light in a storm. They short right out. Should come with warning INDOOR USE ONLY. Literly one drop water and over. They did replace my light (Second one) but I wanted money back so I could by one that works!!
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just 14 months on standby
customer_reviews.text: This spotlight was used on a boat in case of lost items or people overboard. It was left charged and ready 24/7 and only used for a few minutes each month to test that it functions. However, the light failed on the test last month (lights up but shut off after about 2 seconds) and I see it's now outside of the 1 year warranty. It's a sealed unit so we can not service/replace battery so our expectation was a much longer life. For something used so very little to fail like this is very very poor. In our view move on to the 'no cry' or something else that offers a longer coverage period.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Fails within 2 months  no customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2. neither worked within 2 months there is a sticker on them that says don’t return to Amazon and gives a toll free number for replacement. Number puts you on hold and never answers (27 minutes)
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very short cord!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot report on any other features but finding a place to plug it in is almost impossible because the cord is only 14 inches long. How many people want to place a bright yellow large flashlight on their kitchen counter? All other outlets are close to the floor and that is no place to keep this. 14 inches will not even reach to most windowsills or tables from a wall outlet. Am considering returning this. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Beat the F@ck out of it every day on my farm.
customer_reviews.text: Beat the F@ck out of it every day on my farm. Even in -10 degree weather it is reliable. can go a few days without a charge if you forget to plug in. Bright. I let my 6 year old run it and he drops it a lot and beats it fairly hard. I dropped it while climbing around on top of the combine. 14 feet up. It ricochets off some hard steel low down and hit the ground. Still going I will let you know what happens when I run it over with a tractor. I'm due for one of those. This may be the first light to last 2 seasons? been in use since 11/27/2015 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't new...but it seems functional...
customer_reviews.text: Well, this just arrived so i don't know what i think of the product yet...but I'm a bit confused by it arriving in a plain box, not in box from Stanley or in a blister pack. It was packaged safely and doesn't appear damaged and all the parts are there (I guess). And it seems to be functional. However, it's clearly not new so now i don't know what kind of use/wear and tear it has already experienced so that's a bit unsettling for something this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: C. Moss

customer_reviews.title: wasted money
customer_reviews.text: I owned 3 of the original fatmax lights and they were great. Purchased 1 of this new model and after A couple of months would not hold A charge. Burn A few seconds and go out. Don't waste your money. I see from reviews, lots of other people have had this problem.
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: bright light with excellent long distance viewing
customer_reviews.text: We live in rural area with no outside lights, got this mainly to walk my dog. The light range on this is amazing, I can check my entire yard (several acres) by standing in one spot and shining the light. It is slightly bulky and I wish it had something like a wrist cord so I could have the hand free when I turn it off, but not needing batteries is a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Really bright light but the battery life is not great. First couple of times it was charged the battery lasted about a week or so. I only use it to take the dogs out once a night which usually takes only 5-7 minutes. Have had it for 1 year and I now have to charge it every day and the light is still dim. Great light to start with, not so much now and having problems finding out about possible battery replacement. Kind of expensive to just have to throw away after just a year of standard use. Will look for a different brand spotlight.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Liked the 1st one so much bought another a year later!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome flashlight that is insanely bright. Bought one a year ago and liked it so much I bought another one. Highly recommend. The latest version comes with a USB Jack for charging. It also comes with a cigarette lighter adapter so it can be charged at home or in a car. The older version came with a nice string bag to keep it in. That’s my only complaint about the new version. The string bag is no longer included. The advantage is the new one also works as a cell phone charge with the standard USB port for your cable. A nice feature but I don’t know that I would ever use it.
customer_reviews.author: Spike462

customer_reviews.title: For . the man who has everything.
customer_reviews.text: I like bright flashlights. I can't lie. I have tried several, and found this one to be the brightest. I compared the FatMax with NoCry. FatMax is much brighter. The beam is more focused. NoCry is bright...but more like a flood light than a beam. I should have taken pictures... but forgot really. I hunt. At dusk, i like to see what is in the treeline by the reflection from their eyes. The FatMax is great. It's as good as my police issued streamlight mag. (and that's saying something). If you are looking for bright.. this is it. I have not compared or examined the battery life yet.
customer_reviews.author: David Ridings

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable - won’t charge - doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions - charged as directed but the light will not shine! I need to return - sorry that I ordered online - should have gotten it at Lowes like I did my original. Would not recommend buying on line - now the Hustle to return, etc etc. LOWES KNOWS -
customer_reviews.author: Broadway bound

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: The pistol grip on this product is great. The light itself is great. I don't know how the battery life is, but the fact that it is rechargeable is a big plus. One of the things that happen during disasters is that batteries disappear from the store shelves instantly. Having a rechargeable light is a big plus. This light is well made. The only shortcoming that I would like to point out is that there is no trigger lock. I'd like to see a lock which would prevent the inadvertent activation of the light. Other than that, I'd say this is an excellent piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Temmer

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT REPLACE BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: I bought the FatMax for $46.41 on 25 Fab 2018. It was moderately used at home and recharged whenever required. When it would not recharge, I went to replace the battery. YOU CANNOT REPLACE THE BATTERY. A YouTube video shows a very convoluted process including an extensive battery search and soldering the battery connections. Even cheap flashlights provide for easy battery replacement. This "throw away" mentality is absolutely unacceptable. The purpose of buying a rechargeable flashlight is to assure an long life. Stanley deserves a flunking grade for this.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Sherlock

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful tool around the house day and night
customer_reviews.text: This spotlight is a must around our house. It lights up deep corners in cabinets without problems and it shines far so we can see what kind of animal just clawed its way over the fence. It is recommendable to keep one in the car as it has a red lens with various setting to warn other drivers for an emergency. A must around the house and in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L. Bens

customer_reviews.title: Possible pirate product. Totally dead after a few brief uses.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these I have owned. Live in the country and have livestock so in darker times of year used it daily. Recently got a new one late June. Thought it was odd it just came in the box with papers but not the usual plastic packaging. Have used it briefly maybe 5x and it seems to be stone cold dead now. Thinking maybe they are shipping Chinese pirate versions now??
customer_reviews.author: tssis

customer_reviews.title: Super bright and the prong stand is so handy!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many spotlights over the years, and this is by far the best one I’ve ever owned. It’s a good size - not too big not too small, and it’s not too heavy in your hand. It’s very bright, don’t pointed out anyone’s face! The beam shines very far to help you see what you need to see.The little prongs fold out to create a stand for the spotlight which is really handy. I use it almost every day and the battery lasts a long time on the charge. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good affordable spotlight that’s really going to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Richards

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - False Description!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE - I have owned this light before for 5 years until the LED burned out. It was great at 2200 lumens. They STILL describe it as 2200 which is false! After researching it, I learned they have now changed it to 920 which makes it useless for my marine needs. Also, I left it in the cockpit during a heavy rain thinking it would be fine based on its build. However, afterwards I realized water had made its way inside the lens. As an instructor, I recommended my students buy it for years. I will no longer recommend it and will seek a new one to endorse.
customer_reviews.author: G T Best

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight seems well built with some nice features, like a USB charging dock for your electronics. This convinced me of buying it. But after no more than 10 uses, the light died on me. I've tried to contact customer support at the Stanley website, but they never respond. I believe its not a battery issue, because a the USB dock still charges my electronics for hours. I really thought I was buying a good quality product, but its not. I thought I was buying from a serious company, but I guess Stanley is not. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT. LOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE.
customer_reviews.author: Rampantrage

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: This light is pretty bright, but not very durable, despite the appearance. I've purchased three. The first from a big box store, my dog chewed it up. It still works, but I bought a new one from Amazon. The new one charges by USB, which is dumb, because it takes forever. I left it in the rain for one night, instant death. I bought the third, but they just aren't all that great. I use the old dog chewed one more than the new one. It seems that they "upgraded" the light from the first one I purchased, making it far less durable, and adding the dumb USB charger.
customer_reviews.author: Happycustomer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last August (3 1/2 months ago). I use it to take my dogs out for about 10 minutes every night. It's the third FatMax I've bought and the other two work well. It quit working last week. The charging lite still shows green meaning fully charged, but there is no light. I can only assume the led bulb that's supposed to last many hours has burned out, and there is no way to change it as the label says "Risk of Electric Shock. Do not open. No serviceable parts." In the future I'll get something I can service.
customer_reviews.author: anderld47

customer_reviews.title: After a month
customer_reviews.text: This is my second stanley flashlight purchase. The first one was perfect, bright and long lasting battery. While it did not last more then 2 years, it was the best flashlight for the price. I decided to purchase a second one and it has been a nightmare. Does not charge properly, if at all and the battery has only lasted a few hours of on and off use. This was purchased a few days before may19th and can not believe already having problems.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena zeballos

customer_reviews.title: Like the Flashlight, Hate the Charger
customer_reviews.text: This is a BRIGHT flashlight. It doesn't seem to get too hot and it works. Like, really good! Pros: Bright, quick charging, durable Cons: Charging port and discharge port are the same. So you will need to keep the adapter with you so that you can charge. If you lose the adapter, I'm sure you can order a replacement but you won't be able to charge the flashlight at all. Minor pet peeve. Something else small I have to keep around that I will probably lose.
customer_reviews.author: Tara & Wes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had this light since Feb 2018. It worked great initially. It was not used on a daily basis. Used it mainly to check for coyotes and bobcats at night. The last few months it will not stay on the "bright". Now it won't charge. The USB port is rusty and this light has never been left outside. Looking to replace but it will not be with a Stanley. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ksokie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Spotlight!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. We live on an 11 acre spread in south Texas and it is very dark at night especially away from the house and our security lights. We have dogs and we walk them around outside before putting them inside for the night. The coyote population is intense and they can attack/kill dogs. This spotlight can shine down our long driveway (about 400ft) and I can clearly see anything targeted by the beam. The battery lasts a long, long time especially if you follow the instructions and make sure it never completely discharges. It is lighter than other bulkier spotlights I have owned. I will be ordering another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amado

customer_reviews.title: PLEASANTLY SURPRISED SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised that Stanley actually has a good product here. Since China has taken over most of the manufacturing (DUH!), a lot of their "American brand products" (a clone of a Leatherman knife fell apart in less than a year of normal use) have not helped keep their reputation unsullied! A year hasn't even passed yet on this item so I'll update the rating if necessary. One thing for sure. The charge definitely doesn't last long.!
customer_reviews.author: The NO BS Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Brightest spotlight I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Serious light here. I use it for the possibility of having to search for my black Min Pin if he gets out after dark. I believe his reflective collar would be illuminated from quite some distance with this spotlight. Haven't had to use it for this thankfully. I have used it to light up mysterious cars parked around my house with great success. It's bright enough to even let me see thru the tinted rear windows from 50 feet away. This spotlight (and my home defense weapon) is the first thing I grab when something goes "bump" in the night. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: amazon addict

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flashlight 8 months ago, and already the battery is dead and is not charging. VERY disappointing. I wish I could return it or get a replacement. I live alone on a farm and absolutely need a good light. This was perfect, until it stopped holding a charge, then went absolutely dead. I would expect a $50 light to last at least a couple of years!! Its never been in water, so I could not rate the water resistance section as I just don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Cummings

customer_reviews.title: I also love the fact that it rarely needs charging and when ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for work to see in deep tanks and it;s really bright. I also love the fact that it rarely needs charging and when it does I have the option of charging in a car or wall outlet. I wish the prop was also on the bottom by the handle because I want to look into deep holes not up from the floor, but down. I'm sure most people want to look up at something. This is the best flashlight/spotlight I've ever seen or tried and we've tried a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S Wollner

customer_reviews.title: I have owned at least 10 of these
customer_reviews.text: This is not a "flashlight". This is a spotlight. Incredibly powerful and an unbelievably tight beam. I have about 5 or 6 at my ranch for the workers. They raise hell if one ever quits until I replace it. We use them a lot and under harsh conditions. Even so, they last several years before giving out. Under normal household use, they should last many many years. I keep one in our RV, house and lake home too. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Karger

customer_reviews.title: Stanley Fatmax - Came "loose" in a box without packaging
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for the Stanley FatMax SL 10LEDS.....Fatmax came without any sealed packaging....was simply put in a box with the charging cord. Was this a used/returned item??? My brother order the exact Stanley Fatmax from Walmart which came completely SEALED in hard plastic packaging . I hope this is not a damaged/poorly functioning item....only time will tell I guess....otherwise I will be out $53
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Dim light, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not very bright... Picture is with the device plugged in! I bought this as a gift and did not know how bright it was until I visited. I would not have spent money on this and instead spent a little more for something brighter. The lower level light is basically nonexistent LOL! This is basically a cheap flashlight, could have spent much less and have something weight/bulk a lot less. Also, sadly this requires a USB to charge , so you need USB to USB .
customer_reviews.author: Fatoom

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed after using this product for a month plus
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this product I thought "this is exactly what I need" reviews were good. I have had this since Aug.3rd and the brightness has failed, there is only one light feature, the low light. Tried trouble shooting and still the light will not go to the full brightness. I looked today and I am out of the window for return. Not going to buy another one, going to research and find another reliable device.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Harris

customer_reviews.title: Buy it at the store...
customer_reviews.text: I received a used or refurbished light...it was just the components tossed in a box...it works, but not cool that the lenses are full of fingerprints and scratches. I would NOT recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 🦇🦠🚒🚑🚓🚁

customer_reviews.title: When my light arrived, my fiance asked me to ...
customer_reviews.text: When my light arrived, my fiance asked me to return it. I had originally bought it because his dewalt spot light got wet in the rain and stopped working. I told him no way and challenged him to a contest (since the dewalt started working again after it dried out for a couple of days). I won! The low beam on my spotlight was equivalent to the high beam on his light. HAHA! The high beam on this fatmax completely blew his light away! We stand on our deck at night and look down below the field to the treeline (about 100+ yards) - for deer, coyotes and bears. Can see everything clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to scan our property for deer before letting the dogs out. Its plenty bright enough to shine across 10+ acres of land. We use it every night and every morning and I charge it every 2 weeks or so, but have never actually had it die. Would be nice to have a battery level meter. Bought one for my stepfather for christmas for spotlighting, he liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck! Bright and full of great features!
customer_reviews.text: I did lots of research before finally deciding to purchase this light. It's solid, has excellent battery life, and also great features such as two levels of brightness, and the ability to charge other USB devices. Overall I'm completely stoked on this flashlight. When it says 2200 lumens, that is an accurate statement. My poor buddy buys the cheap China lights that claim thousands of lumens, and when I turned this on, it completely washed out his light :)
customer_reviews.author: Along for the Ride

customer_reviews.title: Scary Bright
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Be Careful to not look into this light!! It is scary bright. How they can make a single LED this bright seems like Alien technology. I've owned those million candlepower lights before and thought they were bright... they are nothing compared to this. Press the trigger a second time and you get about a 50% reduction of the light which will likely be the standard use for me. If you have intruders... this would render them helpless if shined in their eyes. I tested it out on raccoons at night and they didn't seem to mind... they seemed to be thankful for the light to help forage for their meals.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Tough, bright, handy and 3 yrs of use so far...
customer_reviews.text: A well made and sturdy light. The adjustable stand is handy and the high-low modes save battery time. We have two of these on our property and use them all the time either as a flashlight or for spotting predators/wildlife. Shine this anywhere near a person and they won't be coming near you! Had these 3 yrs now and still recharging and working great even with regular use... Nothing bad to say. They're a bit large to carry with a handful of other stuff but a smaller clip on type flashlight would make a great back up.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Winston

customer_reviews.title: Fat Max is a good guy : )
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars if it was rain/water resistant, as it is bright, has a convenient fold-down stand, is rechargeable (with identifying lights), and has a one year warranty plus instruction manual. There is a lot to like in this practical spotlight, which can be clicked brighter and dimmer. There is a separate red light-cover included. The lithium ion battery can be recharged in the car's cigarette lighter or in the house's electrical outlet (both plug-ins included). Imported from China by Baccus Global. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Northern SW

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I live on a farm and this thing allows me to see my horses at night from my back door. It is ridiculously bright. Like I can light something up at least 200+ yds away. Im terrible at eyeing distance, I just mean this thing is freaking bright. Its nice that it is rechargeable, I just plug it in by my door so its always ready to go but it lasts for a while between charges. I am really happy with this purchase. I have not found any other high power flashlight that comes close to beating this one out for brightness, portability, and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: K. Maloney

customer_reviews.title: good light for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to my spotlight flash lights and saw the 2000 lumen rating and jumped on it. I have a stream light model similar to this that is 1000 lumens and I have to saw this light from Stanley is only 1000 lumens maybe 1100-1200 but definitely not 2000 but I have to say compared to my stream light it is comparable and for the price you can't beat it
customer_reviews.author: don g1963

customer_reviews.title: Best spotlight ever!
customer_reviews.text: We own several of these and have owned other spotlights. This is the only one we buy now! We got another one because we keep losing the charging cord for the other ones and this updated version has a usb to usb charger which is a lot easier to replace if you lose it. Can’t say enough great things about this spotlight! Our other ones we’ve owned for years. Lighter than most spotlights and by far the brightest one we’ve ever seen!!
customer_reviews.author: Lifestooshort

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item Jan 31. I have maybe used it twice. It will no longer charge and I am very disappointed. I was initially thrilled but it is way to expensive to be a throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Good for boat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a giant hand held incandescence light I bought at west marine years ago that never held a charge and was good for a few minutes of use - and wouldn't work if charging. This light is super bright, lightweight and with high efficiency LED and Li-Ion battery, holds a charge and lasts a long time. Came with AC adapter and cigarette lighter adapter which will be nice offshore away from AC. It also works while plugged into the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Steve STop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This light easily shines out to 100 plus yards. I do not know how long the battery will last.I hope a long time because I could not find a replacement battery .I also do not know how water resistance it is because I dont use it in the rain. I am really impressed with it. I see all kinds of animal life. A good light.
customer_reviews.author: Hornbuckle5405

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it it's garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of these I've bought and the minute it gets wet it stops working. I need a flashlight in Dark Places sometimes or in the middle of badd weather and if it gets wet and doesn't work it's useless. This is nothing but a piece of garbage don't buy it. Run run away from this light. Now after 2 of them not working after one time of getting wet out in the rain I'm out flashlights and 50 bucks. This should not even be sold its a piece of garbage!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Bruns

customer_reviews.title: This flashlight's power is live saving!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! I ordered this due to a power outage this past winter and fumbling around with my old flashlights that were junk, just to light candles. My 91 year old mother & I live together in Cheyenne, WY. Winters can be brutal, but we've never lost power. If it happens again, I'm now prepared with this powerful flashlight! Our safety is of utmost importance. My mother is on oxygen, and her major household unit goes out during a power outage. I need ample light to find her portable tanks!!! This flashlight is a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charge didn't last an hour!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for less than an hour at the ranch and it started to turn off every second. Charged it overnight and it did the same thing the next night which was frustrating out on a gator 200 acres from the house. I am exchanging it in hopes to get one that works properly. The light beam was clear and white and very powerful, just need it to be on to see how great it is. Hopefully I just got a bad one and the next one rocks 7 hours like it claims but honestly I am OK with 3.5 or so.
customer_reviews.author: meganaperkins3

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one not as good as first, toxic offgassing
customer_reviews.text: I already own the older version and love that thing. It's the best spot I've ever owned by far. New one shows up and has a different charging option by using a USB which is fine, but the thing STINKS like hell. It's offgassing incredibly bad. Toxic VOCs are NOT welcome in my vehicle where I planned to keep this... so I'm pretty upset at the lack of environmental compliance in the new manufacturing. This is probably illegal for import because of the air quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S.

customer_reviews.title: Bright, but decides on its own to dim when battery is low
customer_reviews.text: Don't think it's really 2200 lumens. But it's bright enough for most tasks and I really like how the light puts out in a beam and flood simultaneously. One problem however is that when the battery gets low, the light will automatically switch to dim mode and you can't override this. Let me be the brains of my tool, please.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable. Switch stopped working after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flash light to use around my small farm. I just is not durable enough. I dropped once the lens broke light still worked fine but 2 months later it only works on low mode no more high mode which is what I bought it for. Very dissappointed a always liked stanley products but this one is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse Light
customer_reviews.text: I love the line of rechargeable Stanley flashlights. I keep one in the car and one in the house and have never been disappointed by it not working. When it says spotlight it means it, it is super powerful and works amazingly to the back of my property which is half an acre from the back porch to the fence line.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: New style not an improvement
customer_reviews.text: The charging cord is so short it’s impossible to use conveniently. What’s with the UBS connection? When manufacturers change an already great product it’s never an improvement. Go back to the old style charger with a nice long cord so that the flashlight could be set on the floor of a truck while charging. The light is bright and far reaching. My old flashlight still works except the switch won’t stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Quit working on 1 1/2 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on 8/21 and on10/4 it stopped working. I missed my return window of 9/22. Now I’m stuck with an expensive flash light that doesn’t work. I tried to get in touch with the company by using the number they provided on the flashlight but it’s either busy or just rings and rings. One day I was on hold for almost an hour and never did get anyone. I was still on hold 1/2 hr after they closed. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Husband LOVES this little light
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical about this light, however the brightness and length of which you can see is awesome. This is exactly what my husband needed for our back yard. I'm not sure about the battery life because we just got it. However we don't really use it for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: ShanaF

customer_reviews.title: Short Life, if any
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble charging the light out of the box, but them it charged up okay so I did not return it. Light does not charge or turn on and will throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: teja

customer_reviews.title: Flashlight arrived DOA..
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived without packaging . Charging cables , instructions ,lens, etc just thrown in plain brown box Loosely . Flashlight would not work or charge . Bummer . Returning
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure it won't light up the moon
customer_reviews.text: Gifted to replace some junk walmart-esque special hand-lamp. Reeeeeal bright. You can tell because I used extra "e's". Pretty sure it won't light up the moon, but it goes across my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: This flashlight is BRIGHT.
customer_reviews.text: Extreamly bright. I live in the middle of the country. It works well so I can see to the other side of my property very quickly. We have coyotes near us. Its nice to feel like I can see everything clearly before taking my toy breed pug out potty after dark. Has many uses. I was very impressed. Works better than expected. It was a gift for my husband and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Mylinda K.

customer_reviews.title: Super bright light
customer_reviews.text: These fat Max lights are the only ones I buy and the only problem I have with them is the battery life. I have found them to be much brighter than other handheld lights but I have to buy one every year or so but at this price it's worth it to buy one every summer to ensure I have a bright light for the fall time.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Impressive brightness right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I like this spotlight / flashlight because it is very bright and it's easy to charge at home or even in my car. This is now one of my designated car emergency lights because I have experienced its reliability and trust it to work in case of an emergency. The red cap is a cool added feature but is also useful for protecting the light.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty DudeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for grandpa, way better than the incandescent spot lights of the past
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for FIL. Slam dunk, he loves it. He lives out in the woods and enjoys being able to see what's making noise out in the night, even across the river. Very bright, relatively light, runs a long time on a charge. Huge upgrade from incandescent spot lights of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Diesel JonesTop Contributor: Welding

customer_reviews.title: Good light!
customer_reviews.text: I have 1 LED spot light (Cyclops) that I have not been impressed with at all so I was hesitant to buy another 'LED Spot light' but I have to say this one is pretty dang good for LED! I have had a Brinkmann Max Million for years and it would really reach out a long ways (way further than my Cyclops LED would ever go) but this FatMax light will reach out further than the old Brinkmann Max Million ever would! Pretty good light! - reaches a long ways!
customer_reviews.author: D-Man

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Light
customer_reviews.text: Packaged well, delivered quickly. I use this light for checking on my livestock. It easily shines across the pasture 150 yards with a nice bright white stream. It’s very light weight and small compared to my old giant light, and it holds a charge while using. I’ve had it lit up for over an hour. I didn’t test it past that. I hope it will continue to give me years of use.
customer_reviews.author: MyOtherNewName

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this light for a few years and it is still a great light. It still holds a charge for several months without recharging and can still run for a long period of time on the brightest setting. I mostly use this light for river running and it has been a lifesaver when we need to find a camp in the dark. I also bought a similar product from a competitor, at the same time that I bought the Stanley Fatmax, and it has been incredibly disappointing in terms of holding a charge and running time. The Stanley light has been a far better product in my opinion and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: never worked.
customer_reviews.text: does not work. had for barely 1 month and never used outside. wont let me return it now.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Murray

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.  8% of one-star purchasers inform you not to buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Initially worked, but after 3 months in the closet it stopped working. Garbage. See the many other 1-star reports showing product failure. At 8% field failure rate this shows STANLEY cannot manage quality. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Schmoe

customer_reviews.title: It's Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light because I live in East Texas country where there are feral hogs and coyotes. I don't like walking out in the darkness without a flashlight and this light is awesome. I can see across the pasture and down the road with the beam on this light. It's like having a handheld big spot light! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Makes one hell of a gift
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas gift for my father in law. He received a neon glow in the dark flashlight also and had a huge smile when he opened it but when he opened his Stanley... you could literally see the smile in his eyes. He has owned one before and after 15+ years, it died.
customer_reviews.author: L Nealeigh

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: I had a huge light that would not hold a charge and was a real pain to use because of the size and weight but this one is lightweight, easy to use and holds the charge nicely. Extremely bright and I really like it so far. The proof will be if it's still working this well a year or more out but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: MGBSR

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Nice rechargeable spot light. I use it when taking my dog out at night because I live near a forest preserve where coyotes sometimes roam. Has a kickstand on the top and came with an charging adapter for the car. Has a light where you plug it in to charge that turns from red to green when it’s done charging.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Holmes

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this spotlight/flashlight to scan the tree lines for coyotes, since we have heard and seen several out near our home, when we take our dog out at night or in the early morning. Easy to use, durable, great battery life. Very happy with this purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: This is a great spotlight that shines far and provides great visibility. The only down side is that if it's misting or a light drizzle this spotlight will fog up and any water that gets on it will go inside this. This is not even close to being water resistant and is bad for an outdoor spotlight that will probably be used during hunting, fishing or camping where you will definitely run into a little rain or water splashes.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: So bright!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this light! We live in a rural woodsy area in Northern California. This light comes in handy when I take my dog out to pee at night. It’s very bright, and easily helps me identify what’s rustling in the bushes, which is usually deer, rabbits, and an occasional fox. There have been a lot of Bear and Puma sightings in my County since the fires. This spotlight puts my mind at ease.
customer_reviews.author: Ileah

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough about this flashlight. I’m not a big fan of the dark so taking the dog out in the backyard at night wasn’t fun, Lol. Hubby bought this for me and it is super bright. The charge lasts awhile but then I am only using it briefly every day. It seems that it is months before I have to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie F

customer_reviews.title: Very bright!
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I purchased this to spot hogs at night and needed something that would light up the night. This does the job well. It is very bright and light weight. For the most part Ive been using it at a renovation Im working and it is working great. Ive have several people come who needed to borrow it and they are ordering it too. Great light. Lasts a while Id say a good days worth of work. Ive been using it for 4 days and its about dead now. Id recommend charging after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Knowitall

customer_reviews.title: Handheld Spotlight
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say this but ours quit working.It did great for 2 weeks and the handle switch tore up and the light of course. would not come on. The company was very fair and they gave us a refund.
customer_reviews.author: countrybumpin

customer_reviews.title: So bright!
customer_reviews.text: We love this light! It's so bright and covers a lot of distance. Everyone is in awe as to what we can see with it. We use it in our backyard to see spiders, up in the trees, on camping trips and hikes. The red cap comes in very handy when you want to not illuminate everything. When we don't have it handy, we wish we had it with us. We haven't tested the water resistance, so I couldn't give it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Zermeno

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for coyote hunting. upon recieving the first one, it was DOA. Plugged it in for an overnight charge and the charging light would not even come on. The next day still dead. Asked for a replacement and the vendor was very prompt in shipping the new one overnight. Was very pleased with that. The new replacement worked straight out of the box. Plugged it in to charge and the charging light worked as it is suppose to. Have not taken it out at night yet to see how far it will reach out. I give the customer service 5 stars for the vendor. 3 stars for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Commoguy

customer_reviews.title: Puts out some awesome light!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful light that has 2 settings. On high, it shines up to approx. 70-100 yards. I use it to spot animals on the back of our 5 acre property at night before letting the dogs out. I'd recommend this to anyone that has a use for this kind of light. Great for emergencies as well! I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Dawgs

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I honestly really liked this lamp but simply didn’t last. Maybe after 20 hours of use on and off in a coarse of a year the lamp simply stopped working
customer_reviews.author: Enrique13

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and bright bright brighter!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the money. It lights up the entire room better than a model for a teeth whitening commercial. Great range, well thought out by someone who has been stuck on the water at night looking for that next marker. Wish it had interchangeable batteries so you could have a fast change backup if needed but this is by far the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Zahide Marenic

customer_reviews.title: great light, great value
customer_reviews.text: We live out in the country and I bought this to see what's going on outside on the property at night. It really lights up an area and the beam goes a long way out. It stays charged a long time and we've only had to charge it twice in the long time we have had it. I like it so well I just bought another one to keep in my truck for use when responding to calls as a volunteer firefighter and EMT when I go to calls in my personal vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Sub Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Bought another
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for bright led rechargeable light. This is it. It had great reviews so I thought I would give it a try. It puts out a nice bright beam that goes far and lights up my yard. It was such a good light I bought another, and will probably buy another as a gift for family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong Light, Good Distance
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old spotlight I had with this and am very pleased with it. It holds a charge for a decent amount of time and is very bright. I have a very large back yard that goes all the way to the woods at the edge of the property and when I let the dogs out at night, this is exactly what I need to shine a light to see where they are, or to see varmints (i.e. raccoons, deer, foxes) which we have in abundance.
customer_reviews.author: 3Acres

customer_reviews.title: This is the best spotlight I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best spotlight I have ever owned! I will be purchasing another one! Pros: Very bright, roughly comparable to my last 2 candle power heavy light I loved Long battery life between charges, I have used for over an hour before charges. (never actually timed till it died, but over an hour for sure) Very lite. not heavy like other spotlights. Cons: None really. I wish it had a small single LED for if I wanted a little bit of light. But not really a fair comparison since it is not a requirement of spotlights.
customer_reviews.author: IAHNTR

customer_reviews.title: Extremely bright
customer_reviews.text: Very, very bright, even with the red lens snapped on the front. Not too heavy, great for spotting wildlife and checking out the woods. Best flashlight/spotlight of this sort I've ever owned. Highly recommended. It's extremely bright - don't worry about that if you're thinking about buying it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RB601

customer_reviews.title: Good bright light
customer_reviews.text: This a great light, I've had it for a number of years now. I'll use it to lighter my neighbors way at night when she leaves 200 feet away. The charge lasts a long time but I wish there was something to show how much charge is left.
customer_reviews.author: Edw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and really bright!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and bright. We use this to check the corners of our large fenced in yard for critters visiting the bird feeder before we let our three standard poodles out at night. We have floods, but this really lights up so we can see into the corners easily. It also can light up trees well over one hundred yards away. Seems to keep a charge well.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Compact, powerful light
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback is for folks that have large hands. The handle is small...! It also would be nice if the USB charging cable was longer than 12" which is inconvenient for AC charging if counter space is not available and useless for vehicle charging.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Oregon to visit family where we stayed in a cabin in a remote area away from city lights. Also used it for camping on night walks when we wanted to look up trees and across the lake. Compact and very bright. Brother in law who lives in Oregon was impressed and was going to buy one ASAP after he had a few run ins with predators around his property. I would suggest this to anyone living in the country/woods.
customer_reviews.author: Ricci Family

product_meta.title: STANLEY FATMAX SL10LEDS Rechargeable 2200 Lumen Lithium Ion Ultra Bright LED Spotlight Flashlight with USB Power Charger
product_meta.description: The FATMAX SL10LEDS is a 10W Lithium Ion rechargeable spotlight. This ultra-bright LED delivers up to 2,200 lumens; allowing you to illuminate even the darkest of work areas, whether at home, in a vehicle, camping, or during a roadside emergency or power outage. With a runtime of up to 7 hours on low and 1 hour on high, the Lithium Ion battery stays charged for up to 12 months without recharging. This spotlight includes both AC and DC charging adaptors, allowing you to recharge at home or inside a vehicle and a 3 mode trigger with high, low, and off setting. A rugged pistol-grip handle offers a convenient and comfortable grip while the locking, pivoting stand and trigger lock provide hands-free operation. The FATMAX SL10LEDS is not intended to be submerged in water. Includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Delivers up to 2,200 lumens with a 10W ultra-bright LED
Lithium Ion battery stays charged for up to 12 months; Provides a runtime of up to 7 hours on low setting
Collapsible pivoting stand and convenient trigger lock provide hands-free operation
AC and DC charging adaptors are included, allowing you to recharge the spotlight at home or inside a vehicle
Ideal for emergencies, power outages, outdoor activities, and long camping trips
